definition: to learn sth through hearsay/to get wind of sth

sentences.english: What was your reaction when you first got wind of it?
sentences.chinese: 当你第一次风闻这事的时候你是什么反应？

sentences.english: Sally got wind of the rumours about her.
sentences.chinese: 萨利风闻关于她的谣言。

sentences.english: But Father got wind of it, though not quite in time, and was after him as quickly as he could.
sentences.chinese: 但我父亲风闻其事，虽然不太及时，还是尽力地追赶。

sentences.english: Sally got wind of the rumors about her.
sentences.chinese: 萨丽风闻关于她的谣言。

sentences.english: I've heard that he is as well-known as Johnson herself.
sentences.chinese: 我风闻他跟约翰生本人自己一样闻名。

sentences.english: I heard that he is a worker.
sentences.chinese: 我传讲风闻他是一个工人。

sentences.english: But now at last their turn has come. Before, they had only heard of the mystery, but now they feel it.
sentences.chinese: 以前他们只风闻这个奥秘，如今他们亲身尝到了。

definition: to listen/to hear what sb says/news one has heard
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
that being the case/then/in that case
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies

pinyin: xiao1 xi5 ling2 tong1 ren2 shi4
